IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells Transplantation in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: This study is a 24-week single-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. The trial includes a 3-week early screening and lifestyle education period, 6-week treatment period, and 18-week follow-up period. Chinese type 2 diabetic subjects receiving traditional hypoglycemic treatment were randomly assigned to umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cell or placebo infusion therapy to observe the efficacy and safety of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cell infusion therapy.
DescriptionModule.DetailedDescription: This study is a 24-week single-center, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. The trial includes a 3-week early screening and lifestyle education period, 6-week treatment period, and 18-week follow-up period. Chinese type 2 diabetic subjects receiving traditional hypoglycemic treatment（including insulin） were randomly assigned to umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cell or placebo infusion therapy to observe the efficacy and safety of umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cell infusion therapy.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: The volunteers of the experimental group will be given peripheral intravenously a dose of 0.75*10^6/ kg human umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells at 0,1,5,6 week.

ArmGroupInterventionName: Biological: Umbilical Cord Mesenchymal Stem Cells

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: The control group will be given the same dose of saline containing human albumin.

Intervention.InterventionDescription: human umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cells were peripheral intravenous infused to experimental group
saline containing human albumin will be infused to the control group

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: The changes in HbA1C level after transplantation

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Reduction of insulin requirement after transplantation

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: The changes in blood glucose level
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: The changes in blood glucose level after transplantation

Location.LocationFacility: Shanghai East Hospital, Shanghai Tongji University
